content: Actually, in the Jewish culture, turning the other cheek was a sign of defiance. It’d force the person who’s about to slap you, to use their open palm. Therefore, they’d be saying that you’re their equal. They’d use their right hand to slap your right cheek (this was a form of insult). By slapping their left cheek with you’re right hand, you’re presenting an open palm, declaring them as your equal.
